channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Global COVID-19 cases surpass 3.4 million, western Sydney nursing home under investigation as Australia’s death toll stands at 95

item.dc:creator: Michael Lallo
item.description: Now is the perfect time to catch up on the best books, films, television shows and podcasts you might have missed.
item.title: Top fives: Struggling to get motivated? YouTube is surprisingly helpful

item.dc:creator: Marissa Calligeros
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Six more cases linked to Melbourne meatworks cluster; PM will not back down on schools; Boris Johnson says doctors were preparing his death notice

item.description: Chinese diplomats have "gotten into fights with every northern European country with whom they should have an interest," said one French adviser.
item.title: Australia is not alone: global backlash builds against China on coronavirus

item.description: The number of US coronavirus cases has topped 1.1 million as the death toll continues to climb towards 70,000.
item.title: Parks crowded as some US states exit lockdown despite deaths mounting

item.description: People in many parts of the world are emerging from their homes as virus-related restrictions begin to ease, but elsewhere the news is not so positive.
item.title: 'Forty-six days was enough': People across the globe emerge from lockdown

item.dc:creator: Stephen Brook
item.description: If you thought putting a price on carbon was hard, the task of getting digital giants to pay for news, and enforcing it, could be even harder.
item.title: The ACCC is facing a devilishly complex task in forcing Google and Facebook to pay publishers

item.dc:creator: Ross Gittins
item.description: Pushing for sweeping reforms in a fragile economy is like telling a baby who can't walk to train for the Olympics.
item.title: First the Australian economy needs CPR. We’ll worry about reform later

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: A change in legislation could be the only way to avoid Google and Facebook leaving the Australian market.
item.title: Google fires back as ACCC code of conduct talks ramp up

item.dc:creator: Brian Yatman
item.description: A Star Wars threat, no sale of the century, and rector quits over wine
item.title: In the Herald: May 4, 1985

item.dc:creator: Bianca Hall
item.description: Across Australia, about 1.1 million temporary visa holders have been left without federal government supports like JobKeeper and JobSeeker.
item.title: Plea for 1.1 million on temporary visas as expert warns of public health disaster

item.dc:creator: Jewel Topsfield
item.description: Victorian governments have sold off almost 600 hectares of surplus public land over the past two decades, according to a new study which claims it could have been used to address the state’s public housing crisis.
item.title: Calls for surplus land to be used for public housing as pandemic bites

item.dc:creator: Natassia Chrysanthos
item.description: Hospitality, travel and tourism positions in Australia have all but disappeared, while even building and construction placements have dropped by 63 per cent.
item.title: Apprenticeships drop by two-thirds amid looming skills shortage

item.dc:creator: John Shand
item.description: International Jazz Day almost slipped off the calendar this year, but was saved by streaming technology.
item.title: International Jazz Day review: The art of getting distant and personal

item.dc:creator: Tammy Mills
item.description: The Melbourne school at the centre of a coronavirus scare has one of the largest cohorts of students still turning up for class.
item.title: Schools with vulnerable pupils at front line of virus risk: principal

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: The ARL Commission chairman rejects the argument that the NRL will be less valuable for its television partners because of the absence of crowds as Nine and Foxtel seek discounts on their rights fees.
item.title: 'Pay what we ask': V'landys sends message to broadcasters as talks heat up

item.dc:creator: Cameron Houston
item.description: A $3.9 million armed robbery in Melbourne's CBD last week, involving a man with a surgical mask, a gun and a trolley has exposed extraordinary security failings but also reveals the unusual business practices of the city's gold and precious gem dealers.
item.title: Strippers, scrap gold and a $3.9 million heist

item.dc:creator: Mike Foley
item.description: The Morrison government has instructed the Clean Energy Finance Corporation to invest in hydrogen energy projects including those powered by fossil fuels.
item.title: $300m clean energy fund to back fossil-fuel hydrogen projects

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: The Berejiklian government is being urged by a lower house committee to report within months how the promotion of low-carbon technologies can help revive the NSW's economy as well as reducing its dependence on coal.
item.title: 'Never more critical': Government pressed on low-carbon recovery study

item.dc:creator: Roy Masters
item.description: Selling NRL.com to Nine would be a major mistake, according to the man who helped build rugby league's digital arm.
item.title: 'Two-billion-dollar asset': Don't sell digital arm, Grant warns NRL

item.description: I ran my permitted one hour and came home, face red, legs aching, but feeling more optimistic than in weeks.
item.title: After 50 days of one of the world's strictest lockdowns, a run made me deliriously happy

item.description: Australia should prioritise its sovereignty even if 'poking the bear' of the Chinese Community Party is economically painful in the short-term.
item.title: No Sino weakness: China should be held to account

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: NSW high schools are following the lead of their independent counterparts and urging year 12 students back full-time.
item.title: Year 12 given priority as schools plan return - but not all parents are happy

item.dc:creator: Lisa Visentin
item.description: Venues that accrue six or more points in three years risk having their liquor licence revoked for up to 14 days.
item.title: Demerit points system for pubs and clubs in NSW liquor law reforms

item.dc:creator: Matt O'Sullivan
item.description: A leading contamination expert says the EPA has not gone far enough in its oversight of the multibillion-dollar Western Harbour Tunnel project.
item.title: Watchdog 'failing in oversight' of dredging of toxic harbour sludge

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: In Sydney's north, one school is 500 students over capacity, while the neighbouring school is 600 under.
item.title: The Sydney schools exceeding new enrolment caps by almost 1000 students

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Monday, May 4

item.dc:creator: Matt Wade
item.description: A real-time spending tracker shows how the pandemic is changing consumer behaviour.
item.title: Pandemic thrift: consumers are switching to discount brands and borrowing less

item.description: Migrants are more than just a resource to be used to boost the economy, only to be forgotten when they are no longer needed.
item.title: We must support our migrant workers and international students

item.description: I would normally be among the first to join the barricades opposing the new COVIDSafe app, but all norms are out the window.
item.title: I'm a privacy expert - and I've downloaded the COVIDSafe app

item.dc:creator: Nick Toscano
item.description: Energy giant Santos expects a ruling on its long-delayed Narrabri coal-seam gas project by the end of August.
item.title: Santos hopes for Narrabri gas verdict 'no later than August'

item.dc:creator: Nick Galvin
item.description: When the world came to a halt, Opera Australia artistic director Lyndon Terracini knew he needed to keep busy.
item.title: There's nothing like a dame for easing the shutdown blues

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: Foxtel and Stan are both vying for rights to air the premium US channel's shows in Australia.
item.title: HBO seeks streaming option in next Australian content deal

item.dc:creator: Andrew Taylor
item.description: A plan to build apartments in Sydney's south-east may be fast-tracked under a program to boost the economy and create jobs during the COVID-19 crisis.
item.title: 'Socially irresponsible': Meriton bypasses council to build 1900 apartments

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: Australian manufacturers are working together to produce 2000 ventilators in response to the coronavirus crisis.
item.title: 'Control your own destiny': Ventilator project highlights importance of local manufacturing

item.dc:creator: Michael Idato
item.description: Including prequels, sequels and spin-offs there are almost a dozen chapters of Star Wars. But did you realise you actually only need to watch five of them?
item.title: Top five Star Wars movies, viewed in the right order

item.dc:creator: Broede Carmody
item.description: The pay TV provider said it aired thousands of hours of women's sport prior to the COVID-19 shutdowns.
item.title: Foxtel 'confident' it can fulfil under-represented sport obligations

item.dc:creator: Richard Baker
item.description: The Victorian government has placed caveats over properties belonging to the Puffing Billy Preservation Society in the wake of a child sex abuse scandal.
item.title: Paedophile scandal prompts Puffing Billy land grab by state

item.description: 50 years ago, four students were killed by National Guardsmen at Kent State University, Ohio.
item.title: From the Archives, 1970: US campuses erupt in violence

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: The IVF sector - and share prices of those exposed to it - has been hit hard throughout the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: 'Baptism by fire': Virtus Health CEO takes reins as IVF sector faces COVID-19 challenge

item.dc:creator: Josh Dye
item.description: Five new critical voices will be heard across books, visual arts and theatre thanks to grant funding.
item.title: Emerging culture critics announced for the Herald and The Age

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: The move has been condemned by lawyers, saying the Department of Communities and Justice had indicated it would argue that laws restricting payouts to offenders for injuries sustained in custody applied to all claims.
item.title: NSW seeks to curb payouts to victims of child sexual abuse in custody

item.dc:creator: Matt O'Sullivan
item.description: Ratepayers in areas already feeling the economic pain from coronavirus will end up footing the bill if council-run airports chalk up big losses.
item.title: Airports in the bush 'hemorrhaging' money as plunge in flights bites

item.dc:creator: Lissa Christopher
item.description: Resisting the temptation to graze your way through the working week until life returns to normal is challenging, but it can be done.
item.title: Pandemic snacking is real but these tips can help

item.description: Follow our rolling coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Karl Quinn
item.description: The home renovation reality show is starting up again, with a smaller crew, pre-packaged meals and its own brand of hand sanitiser.
item.title: 'May the Fourth be with us': The Block restarts, with added precautions

item.dc:creator: Kylar Loussikian
item.description: Treasurer Dominic Perrottet has joined the Premier in pulling in some influential business types to help the state cope with the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: The heavyweight COVID-19 advisers working behind the scenes

item.description: With no confirmed COVID-19 cases in Victorian prisons and strict preventative measures in place, the cons might outweigh the pros.
item.title: Early release of prisoners a worthy idea, but risks too high

item.dc:creator: Nick Toscano
item.description: Shareholders of boutique lender Members Equity Bank will demand an urgent explanation over concerning claims of borrowers being cut off from personal funds.
item.title: Industry super funds to demand answers as ME Bank borrowers fume

item.dc:creator: Colin Kruger
item.description: Afterpay has dismissed suggestions a $300 million investment from Chinese internet giant could expose the buy now pay later platform to security risks.
item.title: Afterpay dismisses security fears after WeChat owner builds $300m stake
